column2: PENNSYLVANIA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column6: PA

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column6: Look through your back window for children.
column8: Get out of the car and check behind the car.

column2: 2. If the rear of your vehicle  is skidding to the left, you should:
column6: steer left.

column2: 3. Parental consent to conduct breath, blood, and urine tests is:
column4: required for people if you are actually under the influence.
column6: required for people under 16 years old.

column2: 4. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column6: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.
column8: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.

column2: 5. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column6: waterplaning.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: No U-Turn

column2: 7. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 8. The only time drivers do not have to stop for a school bus whose red lights are flashing and stop arm is extended is when they:
column6: can safely pass on the left.
column8: are driving on the opposite side of a divided highway.
column10: are not in a school zone.

column2: 9. When you hear the siren of an emergency vehicle, you must:
column4: pull over to the side of the road and stop.
column6: maintain a constant speed and stay in your lane until the vehicle has passed.
column8: move into the right lane and drive slowly until the vehicle has passed.
column10: slow down until the emergency vehicle passes you.

column2: 10. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.
column6: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column8: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column10: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 11. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column6: the left side

column2: 12. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column6: vehicles from the left.

column2: 13. The road edge on the right side is marked by a ___________ line.
column6: solid yellow

column2: 14. When driving on a one way street and an emergency vehicle with flashing lights is behind your car, you should:
column6: speed up and take the next exit.
column8: slow down until the vehicle passes you.
column10: drive toward the nearest road side and stop.

column2: 15. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column6: must always come to a complete stop.
column8: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column10: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.

column2: 16. Aggressive driving includes:
column4: quick lane changes without a signal.
column6: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.

column2: 17. Green and white signs:
column6: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column8: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column10: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 18. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column6: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column8: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column10: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
